2. Indicates a question for oral reply.
3. ■ Indicates a written question transferred for oral reply upon the request of the relevant
member (Rule 117).
4. ◙ Indicates a question for written reply not yet replied to after 10 working days have expired.

INTERNAL QUESTION PAPER: NATIONAL ASSEMBLY NO 20 - 2009

text.b: QUESTIONS FOR WRITTEN REPLY
FRIDAY, 9 OCTOBER 2009
1474. Ms D Kohler-Barnard (DA) to ask the Minister of Public Works:

page.text: (a) What total amount was spent on (i) the renovations and (ii) security features for
King’s House in Durban and (b) which of the materials and/or fittings used for the
renovation in (i) the main house and (ii) general were (aa) manufactured locally and (bb)
imported;
whether any trees were cut down for any of the renovations; if not, what is the position in
this regard; if so, (a) what types of trees, (b) how many of each species, (c) how old was
each tree and (d) what was the reason for cutting down each of these trees?
NW1685E

text.b: 1475. Mr M Waters (DA) to ask the Minister of Health:

page.text: Whether all radioactive sources, including (a) isotopes, (b) x-ray machines and (c) other
specified sources have to be licensed; if not, why not; if so, (i) what is the process in each
case and (ii) how many licenses have been issued for each category;
whether all the abovementioned radioactive sources have to be inspected; if not, why not;
if so, (a) how often in each case, (b) what are the consequences to the licence holder if
they fail the inspection, (c) who conducts the inspection, (d) what qualifications does
each inspector have and (e) when last was each radioactive source inspected;
what are the international minimum norms and standards with regard to the inspection of
the abovementioned radioactive sources;
whether South Africa meets these minimum standards; if not, why not; if so, what are the
relevant details;
whether there is a backlog with regard to inspections of radioactive sources such as (a)
isotopes, (b) x-ray machines and (c) other specified sources; if so, (i) how many in each
case and (ii) what is the backlog of inspections for the periods (aa) 1 to 180 days, (bb)
181 to 365 days, (cc) 366 to 730 days and (dd) longer than 730 days?
NW1748E

text.b: 1476. Mr L Ramatlakane (Cope) to ask the Minister of Public Enterprises:

page.text: (a) How many tenders were awarded by a certain person (name furnished), (b) to whom
were they awarded, (c) what was the tendered amount (d) for which alleged tender
irregularities was the chief executive officer (CEO) of Transnet suspended, (e) what
amounts were involved in each case and (f) how many service providers were paid above
the original tender amounts;
whether all service providers complied with company and taxation legislation and VAT;
if not, why not; if so, what are the relevant details;
whether any companies were paid from R1 million upwards; if not, what is the position in
this regard; if so, (a) who signed off the said tender, (b) what is the limit amount to be
signed off by the CEO, (c) how many times did the CEO sign tenders above the limited
amount, (d) for what amount in each case and (e) for which service provider, (f) what was
the name of the company and (g) what was the amount involved;
Friday, 9 October 2009
INTERNAL QUESTION PAPER: NATIONAL ASSEMBLY NO 20 - 2009
whether anyone signed to condone the tender awards; if so, who (a) signed and (b)
motivated it;
whether she and the board have taken any steps with regard to these cases; if not, why
not; if so, what steps?
NW1833E

text.b: 1477. Mrs J D Kilian (Cope) to ask the Minister of Communications:

page.text: Whether a meeting of councillors of the Independent Communications Authority of SA
(Icasa) was called to rescind its earlier decision not to get involved in the court action to
stop the listing of a certain company (name furnished); if so, (a) when did the meeting
take place, (b) which councillors (i) were present at that meeting and follow-up meetings
and (ii) tabled the proposal to overturn the earlier decision and (c) what prompted the
councillor(s) to arrange the emergency meeting of Icasa councillors in an attempt to stop
the said listing;
whether a legal cost order was made against Icasa; if so, for what amount;
what was the amount of Icasa’s legal costs in the matter;
whether this expenditure would require virement in the budget allocation for the 2009-10
financial year; if not, what is the position in this regard; if so, what are the relevant
details?
NW1835E

text.b: 1478. Mr L Ramatlakane (Cope) to ask the Minister of Public Enterprises:

page.text: Whether each of the parastatals accountable to her has a comprehensive policy to manage
its workers and to regulate the company’s relationship with its employees; if not, why
not; if so, what (a) is the policy on the (i) raising of grievances by (aa) workers and (bb)
managers, (ii) settling of disputes and (iii) application of disciplinary procedures and (b)
are the further relevant details;
whether all employees and managers are governed by the same policies; if not, what
specific policy governs the (a) workers, (b) managers, (c) executive managers and (d)
chief executive officer (CEO);
whether the manager falls outside the acceptable non-corruption practice that governs
junior workers; if so, (a) who approved these policies, (b) when were they approved, (c)
how many (i) workers were disciplined and subsequently fired in line with this policy and
(ii) appeals were presented and dealt with and (d) what was the action of managers and
CEOs therein;
whether her department has a separate disciplinary code for members of the senior
management service; if not, what is the position in this regard; if so, what are the relevant
details;
whether the general workers support the two-tier policy system; if not, why not; if so,
what are the relevant details?
NW1836E
Friday, 9 October 2009
INTERNAL QUESTION PAPER: NATIONAL ASSEMBLY NO 20 - 2009
1479. Dr C P Mulder (FF Plus) to ask the Minister of Home Affairs:†
Whether a certain person (details furnished) was part of a syndicate of West Africans
who, in conjunction with officials of her department, forged marriage certificates in order
to indicate that foreigners were married to South African women without their
knowledge;
whether the Government has taken any legal action against the said person; if not, why
not; if so, what action;
whether the said person, during his stay in South Africa as a medical student and doctor,
attempted to acquire South African citizenship with a forged marriage certificate; if so,
(a) when did her department become aware of the forged marriage certificate and (b)
what steps did her department take against him;
whether he was provided with a divorce certificate; if not, why not, if so, what are the
relevant details;
whether he may re-enter South Africa in order to (a) work or (b) travel; if so, what are the
relevant details in each case?
NW1840E
1480. Dr C P Mulder (FF Plus) to ask the Minister of International Relations and Cooperation:†
Whether the approval of a certain person (details furnished) was initially held back by her
predecessor after he was proposed by his government as ambassador to South Africa; if
not, why not; if so, what was the reason for the delay;
whether her predecessor informed her about the reasons for the delay; if so,
whether the reasons for the Government’s delay in approving his appointment still
remain; if not, what is the position in this regard; if so, why has her department now
granted approval for his appointment to South Africa?
NW1841E

text.b: 1481. Mr J Schmidt (DA) to ask the Minister of Energy:

page.text: Whether her department organised or hosted (a) an imbizo, (b) a seminar, (c) conference
and (d) any other function during the period 1 January 2006 up to the latest specified date
for which information is available; if so, (i) on what date, (ii) what was the total amount
spent on each, (iii) what is the breakdown of the cost in each case and (iv) how many
guests attended in each case;
whether there were any related costs for the travel and accommodation of guests for each
of the events; if so, in each case, (a) what were the costs and (b) what was the breakdown
of these costs;
whether any member of the Cabinet was present at any of these events; if so, (a) who, (b)
in what capacity and (c) why?
NW1882E
Friday, 9 October 2009
INTERNAL QUESTION PAPER: NATIONAL ASSEMBLY NO 20 - 2009

text.b: 1482. Mr J Schmidt (DA) to ask the Minister of Energy:

page.text: Whether her department developed and adopted a policy providing guidelines for the
appointment of persons with a criminal record; if so, (a) when was the policy (i)
developed and (ii) adopted and (b) where can a copy of the policy be obtained; if not,
whether her department has any plans in place to develop and adopt such a policy; if not,
why not; if so, what are the relevant details;
whether her department does any pre-employment screening of potential employees for
criminal records; if not, why not; if so, what are the relevant details;
whether any employees with criminal records are currently employed by her department;
if so, (a) how many and (b) what is their (i) job level and (ii) occupational category?
NW1883E

text.b: 1483. Mr J Schmidt (DA) to ask the Minister of Energy:

page.text: Whether all (a)(i) offices and (ii) sites of her department and (b) entities reporting to her
adhere to the Occupational Health and Safety Act, Act 85 of 1993; if not, (aa) why not,
(bb) which facilities fail to adhere to the Act, (cc) where are they situated, (dd) what (aaa)
aspects of the Act does each such facility not comply with and (bbb) action has been
taken in each case; if so, what are the relevant details;
(a) how often should each facility be inspected and (b) when last was each facility
inspected?
NW1884E
1484. Mr S B Farrow (DA) to ask the Minister of Transport :
What part of the approximately R105 million earmarked for Environmental Impact
Assessment Record of Decision (EIA/ROD) costs at the La Mercy Airport has been
allocated to (a) noise/air quality monitoring and (b) access road changes;
whether any provision has been made for the relocation or insulation of the
approximately 1330 households identified as possibly affected by high noise levels; if
not, why not; if so, what are the relevant details;
whether any contracts have been finalised in terms of the Dube Trade Port portion of the
project; if not, why not; if so, (a) how many and (b) to what value;
whether any progress has been made with regard to the establishment of the proposed
Agri-zone, if not, why not; if so, to what extent?
NW1887E
1485. Mr P J C Pretorius (DA) to ask the Minister of Agriculture, Forestry and Fisheries:
Whether game farming is regarded as an agricultural activity; if not, why not;
whether her department has a policy on game farming; if not, why not; if so, what are the
relevant details;
whether she will make a statement on the issue of cattle farmers changing to game
farming;
Friday, 9 October 2009
INTERNAL QUESTION PAPER: NATIONAL ASSEMBLY NO 20 - 2009
whether prospective game farmers must meet any legal requirements to be allowed to
change from cattle to game farming; if so, (a) why and (b) what requirements;
whether she will make a statement on the issue of game farming being part of
agriculture?
NW1888E
1486. Mr P J C Pretorius (DA) to ask the Minister of Agriculture, Forestry and Fisheries:
What percentage of total land area of the former (a) Transkei and (b) Ciskei is (i) suitable
for agricultural purposes and (ii) currently being used for agricultural purposes;
what are the current (a) major agricultural activities and (b) production volumes in the
areas;
whether her department has any plans to increase agricultural activity in the areas; if not,
why not; if so, what are the relevant details?
NW1889E

text.b: 1487. Mr P J C Pretorius (DA) to ask the Minister of Agriculture, Forestry and Fisheries:

page.text: Whether her department has a policy on accommodation for farm workers; if not, why
not; if so, what are the relevant details;
whether her department has any plans to contribute financially towards providing
accommodation for farm workers; if not, why not; if so,
whether she will make a statement on the matter?
NW1890E

text.b: 1488. Mr M Waters (DA) to ask the Minister of Health:

page.text: Whether any province placed a moratorium on the provision of any health services (a) in
the (i) 2006-07, (ii) 2007-08 and (iii) 2008-09 financial years and (b) during the period 1
April 2009 up to the latest specified date for which information is available; if so, (aa)
which province, (bb) when was the moratorium put in place, (cc) who initiated the
moratorium, (dd) which services were affected, (ee) how many people were affected and
(ff) what were the reasons for the moratorium in each case;
whether any of the above moratoriums gave rise to litigation; if so, what (a) action has
been taken against those who initiated the moratorium and (b) are the further relevant
details?
NW1891E

text.b: 1489. Mr M Waters (DA) to ask the Minister of Health:

page.text: Whether the financial shortages experienced by the Free State health department led to an
increase in the waiting list for antiretroviral medication (ARVs); if so, (a) what was the
number of people on this waiting list before the moratorium was put in place, (b) what
was the number of people on the waiting list after the moratorium was lifted and (c) what
is the current number of people on the waiting list;
what is the number of people currently on the waiting list in each of the other provinces;
whether any studies and/or reports have been conducted to determine the number of
additional deaths that occurred as a direct result of the moratorium; if not, why not; if so,
how many?
NW1892E
Friday, 9 October 2009
INTERNAL QUESTION PAPER: NATIONAL ASSEMBLY NO 20 - 2009

text.b: 1490. Ms E More (DA) to ask the Minister of Trade and Industry:

page.text: Whether the National Lottery Distribution Fund has received any application for funding
from a certain training trust (name furnished); if so, in each case (a) on what date, (b) for
what amount, (c) on what date was the decision made regarding the application and (d)
what was the outcome of the application;
whether any lower amount was granted to the said training trust; if so, what was the
reason for the lower amount being awarded in each case?
NW1894E

text.b: 1491. Ms E More (DA) to ask the Minister of Human Settlements:

page.text: What are the risks of climate change to human health in South Africa that have been
identified by his department;
whether his department is taking any measures to promote adaptation to climate change
in the health sector; if not, why not; if so, what measures;
whether any study has been conducted to determine the costs that health sector will incur
in adapting to climate change; if not, why not; if so, what are the relevant details;
whether any measures are being examined to finance adaptation to climate change in the
health sector; if not, why not; if so, what measures?
NW1895E

text.b: 1492. Ms E More (DA) to ask the Minister of Health:

page.text: Whether his department organised or hosted (a) an imbizo, (b) a seminar, (c) conference
and (d) any other function during the period 1 January 2006 up to the latest specified date
for which information is available; if so, (i) on what date, (ii) what was the total amount
spent on each, (iii) what is the breakdown of the cost in each case and (iv) how many
guests attended in each case;
whether there were any related costs for the travel and accommodation of guests for each
of the events; if so, in each case, (a) what were the costs and (b) what was the breakdown
of these costs;
whether any member of the Cabinet was present at any of these events; if so, (a) who, (b)
in what capacity and (c) why?
NW1896E
1493. Mrs S P Kopane (DA) to ask the Minister of Health:
Whether the SA Nursing Council has finalised regulations in terms of the Nursing Act,
Act 33 of 2005, for the regulation of private nursing colleges; if not, why not; if so, when;
whether his department is taking any action to resolve the problems caused by the long
delay in (a) finalising these regulations and (b) the shortfall in the number of
opportunities for training; if not, why not; if so, what action in each case?
NW1897E
Friday, 9 October 2009
INTERNAL QUESTION PAPER: NATIONAL ASSEMBLY NO 20 - 2009
1494. Mrs S P Kopane (DA) to ask the Minister of Social Development:
(a) How many (i) public and (ii) private registered (aa) shelters and (bb) drop-in centres
are there, (b) in which provinces are they and (c) how many children are currently
accommodated at each of these places;
whether all centres are registered with her department; if not, (a) why not, (b) which
centres are not registered with her department and (c) in which provinces are they
situated; if so, how many are registered (i) permanently and (ii) temporarily;
whether all the (a) public and (b) private registered (i) shelters and (ii) drop-in centres
have been inspected in order to ensure that they meet minimum standards; if not, (aa)
why not, (bb) which shelters and drop-in centres have not been inspected, (cc) when will
they be inspected and (dd) for how long has each of them been operating without being
inspected; if so, (aaa) when was each inspection conducted at each shelter and centre,
(bbb) who conducted each of the inspections and (ccc) what are the minimum standards
that must be met by each shelter and drop-in centre;
whether any shelters and drop-in centres have failed to meet the minimum standards; if
so, (a) which shelters and drop-in centres and (b) what was the result of their failing to
meet the minimum standards;
(a) what amount was allocated for the funding of each (i) public shelter and (ii) drop-in
centre in each of the past three financial years and (b) what is the (i) actual and (ii)
optimal number of (aa) doctors, (bb) nurses, (cc) social workers, (dd) forensic social
workers and (ee) other specified staff at each shelter and drop-in centre?
NW1898E
1495. Mrs S P Kopane (DA) to ask the Minister of Social Development:
(a) How many children’s homes are there in the country, (b) in which provinces are they
and (c) how many children are currently accommodated at each children’s home;
whether all the children’s homes are registered with her department; if not, (a) why not,
(b) which centres are not registered with her department and (c) in which provinces are
they situated; if so, how many are registered (i) permanently and (ii) temporarily;
whether all the children’s homes have been inspected in order to ensure they meet
minimum standards; if not, (a) why not, (b) which children’s homes have not been
inspected, (c) when will they be inspected and (d) for how long has each of them been
operating without being inspected; if so, (i) when was each inspection conducted at each
children’s home, (ii) who conducted each of the inspections and (iii) what are the
minimum standards that must be met by each children’s home;
whether any children’s homes have failed to meet the minimum standards; if so, (a)
which children’s homes and (b) what was the result of their failing to meet the minimum
standards;
(a) what amount was allocated for the funding of each children’s home in each of the past
three financial years and (b) what is the (i) actual and (ii) optimal number of (aa) doctors,
(bb) nurses, (cc) social workers, (dd) forensic social workers and (ee) other specified staff
at each children’s home?
NW1899E
Friday, 9 October 2009
INTERNAL QUESTION PAPER: NATIONAL ASSEMBLY NO 20 - 2009

page.text: Whether his department is taking any steps to retrieve the (a) outstanding debt of R419 million
owed to his department by a number of (i) national departments and (ii) public entities and (b)
other outstanding debt of R67 million as reported by the Auditor-General in his department’s
annual report for the 2008-09 financial year; if not, why not; if so, what are the relevant details?

page.text: Whether his department developed and adopted a policy providing guidelines for the
appointment of persons with a criminal record; if so, (a) when was the policy (i)
developed and (ii) adopted and (b) where can a copy of the policy be obtained; if not,

text.b: 1499. Mr A C Steyn (DA) to ask the Minister of Human Settlements:

page.text: Whether his department is taking any steps to offset its carbon footprint; if not, why not; if so,
what are the relevant details?
NW1903E

text.b: 1500. Mr A C Steyn (DA) to ask the Minister of Human Settlements:

page.text: Whether there are any plans to introduce energy-saving initiatives in the building of new
subsidised homes; if not, why not; if so, what are the relevant details;
whether there are any plans to introduce policy or legislation to encourage future private
homeowners and/or developers to make use of energy-saving initiatives in the
construction of their new homes; if not, why not; if so, what are the relevant details?
NW1904E

text.b: 1501. Mr A C Steyn (DA) to ask the Minister of Human Settlements:

page.text: What are the risks of climate change to human settlements in South Africa that have been
identified by his department;
whether his department is taking any measures to promote adaptation to climate change
in human settlements; if not, why not; if so, what measures;
whether any study has been conducted to determine the costs that human settlements will
incur in adapting to climate change; if not, why not; if so, what are the relevant details;
whether any measures are being examined to finance adaptation to climate change in the
human settlements sector; if not, why not; if so, what measures?
NW1905E

text.b: 1502. Dr H C van Schalkwyk (DA) to ask the Minister for the Public Service and Administration:

page.text: (a) At which levels are public servants in each department entitled to receive a (i) cellular
phone for business purposes and (ii) cellular phone allowance, (b)(i) what is the credit
limit for each of the levels in each month and (ii) are the other benefits regarding cellular
phones, (c) what action is taken when an official exceeds the credit limit and (d) what is
the total amount spent on cellular phones in each government department in the (i) 2007-
08, (ii) 2008-09 and (iii) from 1 April 2009 up to the latest specified date for which
information is available;
whether any mechanisms are in place to ensure that every cellular phone account is
monitored for business use only; if not, why not; if so, what mechanisms?
NW1906E

text.b: 1503. Dr H C van Schalkwyk (DA) to ask the Minister for the Public Service and Administration:

page.text: (a) How many cases of fraud and corruption have been reported since the creation of the
State Information Technology Agency (Sita) in 1999, (b) how many of these cases have
been investigated, (c) how many officials have been identified to be involved in fraud and
corruption, (d) what action has been taken against these officials and (e) what steps has
Sita taken to prevent fraud and corruption regarding tender processes;
whether any companies that benefited from tainted procurement practices have been
investigated; if not, why not; if so, (a) how many companies were found to be involved,
(b) what are their names and (c) what are the details of their involvement;
whether companies which were found to be involved in fraud and corruption have been
blacklisted; if not, why not; if so, what are the relevant details?
NW1907E
1504. Dr H C van Schalkwyk (DA) to ask the Minister for the Public Service and Administration:
(a) What is the exact amount involved in the double payments to State Information
Technology Agency (Sita)
reported in a certain report (details furnished) and (b) what
mechanisms does Sita have in place to monitor double payments;
whether the board chairperson has been convicted on 12 counts of late payment of
employee tax to the SA Revenue Service; if so, (a) what steps have been taken against the
chairperson, (b) what steps will be taken to improve the negative impact this has on Sita’s
reputation and (c) what mechanisms are in place to ensure good governance in this
regard;
Friday, 9 October 2009

whether he has taken any steps against a certain person (details furnished) for conflicting
business interests; if not, why not; if so, what steps;
what is the rate of compliance with the financial disclosure framework (FDF) in Sita;
whether Sita requires its employees to declare spousal and family interests linked to its
business operations; if not, why not; if so, (a) how many (i) spouses and (ii) family
members of employees benefited from tenders awarded in the past 10 years and (b) to
which Sita employees were such beneficiaries related?
NW1908E
1505. Mr A P van der Westhuizen (DA ) to ask the Minister of Basic Education:
What was the average of the raw marks achieved by candidates in the National Senior
Certificate Examination in November 2008 before the inclusion of year marks and
statistical adjustments by Umalusi, for (a) Mathematics (i) Paper 1, (ii) Paper 2 and (iii)
Paper 3, (b) Accounting and (c) Physical Science (i) Paper 1 and (ii) Paper 2;
what would have been the final mark per subject of a candidate who achieved a raw mark
of 20% in the examination papers and for whom a year mark of 50% was submitted if
both this year mark and the mark achieved in the examinations reflected the average of
the marks for the learner cohort of a particular school for Mathematics Paper 1 and Paper
2, Accounting and Physical Science?
NW1909E
1506. Mr A P van der Westhuizen (DA) to ask the Minister of Trade and Industry:
Whether security clearance is a requirement for the post of Chief Information Officer
(CIO) of the Companies and Intellectual Property Registration Office (Cipro); if not, why
not; if so,
whether the CIO of Cipro has been vetted by the National Intelligence Agency; if not,
why not; if so, what are the relevant details?
NW1910E

text.b: 1507. Mr A P van der Westhuizen (DA) to ask the Minister of Trade and Industry:

page.text: What was the difference in the points scored by a certain company (name furnished) to
the value of R153 million and the tender submitted by another bid company (name also
furnished) for an enterprise content management system for the Companies and
Intellectual Property Registration Office
Cipro);
whether the tender was awarded on the basis that the successful bidding company (a)
offered the best value for money and (b) has a track-record to deliver on a contract of this
magnitude; if so, (a) how was this conclusion reached and (b) what are the further
relevant details; if not,
whether he will take steps to set aside the award of this tender; if not, why not; if so, what
are the relevant details?
NW1911E
